intro: Kolobopetalum veilchianum, commonly known as the Veilchianum tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces fruits that are capsule-like in structure. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
